Text:
I restored our new SS2012 db from the old SS2008 version.
I have a FTS on one of the tables and the search on the SS2012 db shows the same results as the 2008 data but when I insert a new row into the SS2012 version with matching text, I only see the pre-existing rows and not the new ones. examples from the 2012 db (note:rows 1 and 2 are from the restore): select * from tablename where contains(field1, 'abc');
results...
pk field1 datestamp
1 'abc' 9/26
2 'abc' 9/27

select * from tablename where field1 like '%abc%';
results...
pk field1 datestamp
1 'abc' 9/26
2 'abc' 9/27
3 'abc' 9/28

Clues?

I restored our new SS2012 db from the old SS2008 version.
I have a FTS on one of the tables and the search on the SS2012 db shows the same results as the 2008 data but when I insert a new row into the SS2012 version with matching text, I only see the pre-existing rows and not the new ones. examples from the 2012 db (note:rows 1 and 2 are from the restore): select * from tablename where contains(field1, 'abc'); results pk field1 datestamp 1 'abc' 9/26 2 'abc' 9/27 select * from tablename where field1 like '%abc%'; results pk field1 datestamp 1 'abc' 9/26 2 'abc' 9/27 3 'abc' 9/28 Clues?

I restored our new SQL Server 2012 database from the old SQL Server 2008 version.

I have a FTS on one of the tables and the search on the SQL Server 2012 database shows the same results as the 2008 data but when I insert a new row into the SQL Server 2012 version with matching text, I only see the pre-existing rows and not the new ones.

Examples from the SQL Server 2012 database (note:rows 1 and 2 are from the restore):

    select * 
    from tablename 
    where contains(field1, 'abc');

results

    pk     field1      datestamp  
    1       'abc'       9/26
    2       'abc'       9/27 


    select * 
    from tablename 
    where field1 like '%abc%'; 

results

    pk     field1      datestamp 
    1       'abc'       9/26 
    2       'abc'       9/27 
    3       'abc'       9/28 

Clues?
